Key Match Events: The Kings outsmarted the Celtics in a chess match of strategy and execution, exposing Boston’s lack of effort and defensive lapses.
The Kings came into TD Garden, shot, and made more threes than the Celtics—beating the champs at their own game.
The Celtics struggled to contain the Kings on pick-and-roll actions, with Jaylen Brown forgetting to switch and leaving Sabonis open.
Jayson Tatum struggled against the Kings' two-player defensive blitz, resulting in 8 turnovers and a lack of offensive contributions in the fourth quarter.
DeMar DeRozan performed well in the fourth quarter, scoring 12 points and delivering 4 assists, while the Celtics collapsed defensively.
Post-Match Reflections: Celtics coach Mazzulla mentioned the loss isn't a long-term effort thing.
The Kings' defensive strategy involved sending two players at Jayson Tatum to force the Celtics into a 4-on-3 situation.
